instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Connector broken
threads.message:
Hi,
i have 2 board with connector broken on the first picture (J9100) connector sensor LCD iMac 2011 (27'), what is the name of this kind of connector? where can i buy it.
and for the mac mini connector on the right, same question?
i haven't donner board.
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]Connector broken
threads.message:
The mac mini one is the same as all speaker connectors on macbook board so take from donor.
The iMac connector is here: [URL="http://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Molex/53780-0270/?qs=IvJWhXmDNxETb6Tkq%252bXyZg%3D%3D"]http://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/...252bXyZg%3D%3D[/URL]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Connector broken
threads.message:
all connector speaker on all my board are 4 pins not 5 pins. i try to find on your website.
thanks for imac connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]Connector broken
threads.message: The connector in the picture  is 4 pin.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]Connector broken
threads.message:
sorry but it's the broken at the right of the connector 4 pin. i find it on farnell Pico-EZmate 
thanks you can close my post
